events.title: The new Line of Communication Command was to comprise the existing 202 and 404 Lines of Communication Areas and the Fort Hert
events.description: 108. On the 9th November, I issued orders for the formation of a command and staff for the lines of communication, to centralise the lines ‘of communication under a separate ‘Commander and thus relieve the Commander, Fourteenth Army, and Commander, 15 Indian Corps, of responsibilities for their rear areas. The new Line of Communication Command was to comprise the existing 202 and 404 Lines of Communication Areas and the Fort Hertz Area. The rear boundaries of. Fourteenth Army and 15 Indian Corps were to be adjusted as the progress of operations dictated, in order to relieve the forward Commander of administrative responsibilities.

events.title: My third Operation Instruction dated the 9th November, was addressed to the Commander of 15 Indian Corps. 109.
events.description: 109. My third Operation Instruction dated the 9th November, was addressed to the Commander of 15 Indian Corps.

events.title: CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery. Please submit your best shots
On 9th November the first Germans landed at El Aouana airport, Tunis. By 13th November I
events.description: As I have already stated, on 9th November the first Germans landed at El Aouana airport, Tunis. By 13th November I had occupied Bougie and Djidjelli.

events.title: General Giffard had issued an Operation Instruction to the Commander, 15 Corps, defining his task in Arak
events.description: On the 9th November, General Giffard had issued an Operation Instruction to the Commander, 15 Corps, defining his task in Arakan in accordance with the above Directive.

events.title: The Supreme Allied Commander issued a Planning Directive (19th November) in which he ordered plans to be made for
events.description: 15. A week after I had assumed my new Command, the Supreme Allied Commander issued a Planning Directive (19th November) in which he ordered plans to be made for the execution of “the stages of operation Capital [the plan for the advance into Central Burma] necessary to the security of existing air supply routes and the opening of land communications with China and the exploitation of Capital throughout 1945 as far as may be possible without prejudicing the preparation for the execution of Dracula [the plan for the amphibious assault on Rangoon} at the very earliest date possible after the end of the monsoon in 1945.” (1 quote the actual words of the. directive.)
